instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437 Failed PBUS sensor
threads.message:
Mac runs normally and charges battery. PBUS sensor in hardware profile says zero volts. I replaced Q5500 and checked the resistors and cap on the circuit line and everything measures ok. PPBUS without a battery is 8.58 volts. With a battery, it starts at 7.6 with the machine off and the charger plugged in then as it boots it goes up to 8.4 volts. The battery is only at 15%, so my question is once again

1. Does this matter and should I stress over it?
2. Could the sensor be pulled down by a old or shit battery?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437 Failed PBUS sensor
threads.message: It should certainly not read 0V. Also you replace stuff before measuring? Q5500 pin 4 is the input and pin 3 the output then a voltage divider and to the SMC. Measure first.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437 Failed PBUS sensor
threads.message: Ok will measure and see what's up with that one.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437 Failed PBUS sensor
threads.message: So Q5500 has 8.58 volts on input but zero volts on output. SMC_SENSOR_PWR_EN is 3.42 volts. R5503 measures normal but R5504 measures 4.56K not 5.49K. This may be a dumb question but is R5504 bad or could something else be making that measurement low?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437 Failed PBUS sensor
threads.message: Replaced Q5500 now power passes through it still fails sensor test. Measured R5501, R5503, and R5504 and they all measure correctly now. R5504 is now 5.49K. C5504 is not shorted. Does this mean crap under the SMC is failing the sensor test?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437 Failed PBUS sensor
threads.message: You should have about 4.3V on pin 5 and 8.5V on pin 3, if not, maybe a broken trace or bad resistor between pin 4-R5501-R5502-pin 6....

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437 Failed PBUS sensor
threads.message: what voltage do you have on SMC_PBUS_VSENSE?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437 Failed PBUS sensor
threads.message: 1.44 volts. I'm guessing that's way too low?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437 Failed PBUS sensor
threads.message: no, in fact is perfectly fine, seems a problem with SMC, any signs of water damage???

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437 Failed PBUS sensor
threads.message: Yes definitely had water damage at some point. Would this be a dead SMC or maybe just crap under the SMC?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437 Failed PBUS sensor
threads.message: Also continuity between resistors and Q5500 so that's good.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437 Failed PBUS sensor
threads.message:
Apply some flux and heat, most of the time this works....

Yes, if you have 1.4V at SMC_PBUS_VSENSE Q5500 is working properly

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437 Failed PBUS sensor
threads.message: Ok will try that and report back.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437 Failed PBUS sensor
threads.message: Zero dice. Sensor still fails despite reflow. Would this mean SMC is partially dead or would this be anything else? I'm out of ideas on this one.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437 Failed PBUS sensor
threads.message: Ok now I feel dumb lmfao. The only thing I didn't try was a different battery. With a FOR SURE known good, it passes the sensor lmaooooo. The battery that was with the machine says condition NORMAL in the OS, but it causes the sensor to fail. All that for a DAMN BATTERY LOL that sucks but mark this as sovled

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437 Failed PBUS sensor
threads.message: Also learned a partially bad battery will cause VP0R to fail. Learn something new every day! Thank you Duke and apprendiz for the help tho I really appreciate it.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437 Failed PBUS sensor
threads.message: Only if the battery was completely drained. Let it charge up for a while and try again.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437 Failed PBUS sensor
threads.message: It was at about 50% when testing so I'm guessing it's toast.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437 Failed PBUS sensor
threads.message: Tested with the battery still fails sensor. With known good it passes so battery toast. Board fixed tho thank you to all you guys glad this worked out!
